DOC.brief_summary: This trial 12-week , randomize , double-blind , placebo control , multicenter , 4-treatment parallel group study safety efficacy JZP-110 treatment excessive sleepiness adult subject narcolepsy .
DOC.brief_title: `` Twelve-week Study Safety Efficacy JZP-110 Treatment Excessive Sleepiness Narcolepsy ''
DOC.criteria: Major 1 . Males females 18 75 year age , inclusive 2 . Diagnosis narcolepsy accord ICSD3 DSM5 criteria 3 . Body mass index 18 < 45 kg/m2 4 . Consent use medically acceptable method contraception 5 . Willing able provide write informed consent Major 1 . Female subject pregnant , nursing , lactate 2 . Moderate severe sleep apnea baseline PSG . 3 . Any clinically relevant medical , behavioral , psychiatric disorder narcolepsy associate excessive sleepiness 4 . History presence bipolar disorder , bipolar related disorder , schizophrenia , schizophrenia spectrum disorder , psychotic disorder accord DSM5 criterion 5 . History presence acutely unstable medical condition , behavioral psychiatric disorder ( include active suicidal ideation ) , surgical history could affect safety subject interfere study efficacy , safety , PK assessment , ability subject complete trial per judgment Investigator 6 . History bariatric surgery within past year history gastic bypass procedure 7 . Presence history significant cardiovascular disease 8 . Use overthecounter ( OTC ) prescription medication could affect evaluation excessive sleepiness 9 . Use medication could affect evaluation cataplexy 10 . Received investigational drug past 30 day five halflives ( whichever longer ) 11 . Previous exposure participation previous clinical trial JZP110 ( ADXN05 , R228060 , YKP10A ) 12 . History phenylketonuria ( PKU ) history hypersensitivity phenylalaninederived product
